meanings.sent1: She painted her room in a lovely tan color.
meanings.sent2: The sand on the beach had a warm tan hue.
meanings.sent3: The tan sweater matched her eyes perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The old book had pages the color of tan parchment.
meanings.sent5: The tan of the autumn leaves was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: To become brown from exposure to the sun.
meanings.sent1: After spending hours at the beach, her skin began to tan.
meanings.sent2: He forgot to apply sunscreen and started to tan quickly.
meanings.sent3: She joked that she would tan like a piece of leather if she stayed out any longer.
meanings.sent4: The wooden deck tanned under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The bread will tan in the oven for about 20 minutes.

meanings.definition: A brown color obtained by exposure to the sun.
meanings.sent1: Her tan was a result of spending the entire summer outdoors.
meanings.sent2: The tan on his face showed he had been working outside.
meanings.sent3: The tan on the leather jacket gave it a rugged look.
meanings.sent4: The tan of the wood on the porch was deep and rich.
meanings.sent5: The tan of the landscape changed as the sun set.

meanings.definition: A solution used for tanning animal hides.
meanings.sent1: The tanner used a special tan to treat the hides.
meanings.sent2: The smell of the tan in the workshop was strong.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally spilled the tan on her shoes, staining them.
meanings.sent4: The tan transformed the raw hides into soft leather.
meanings.sent5: The tan was carefully applied to ensure even coverage.
